snippet: A deadly assault on an airport in Karachi showed how, despite the Pakistani Taliban’s challenges and deepening divisions, their reach has extended into Pakistan’s biggest city.
abstract: Pakistani Taliban's deadly assault on Karachi's international airport shakes country to its core, offering violent reminder that for all its divisions, Taliban remains astonishingly resilient force; terrorist group's ability to draw on international militant network to conduct sophisticated attacks means trouble not just for Pakistan, but for American interests in Afghanistan.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Saba Imtiaz from Karachi, Pakistan, and Salman Masood and Isanullah Tipu Mehsud from Islamabad, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: A deadly assault on an airport in Karachi showed how, despite the Pakistani Taliban’s challenges and deepening divisions, their reach has extended into Pakistan’s biggest city.

headline.main: Assault on Pakistan Airport Signals Taliban’s Reach and Resilience
headline.print_headline: Assault Signals Taliban’s Reach and Resilience
